title: Scaling
content:
Your suite system has scalability. As a suite admin, you can scale up your system as needed.

Overview

The following gives an overview of the scalability of your suite system. 

Types of scaling

Your suite system supports the following types of scaling:

  • Suite deployment scaling: Before a version upgrade, you have the option to increase the existing deployment size. 
  • Suite capabilities scaling: You can scale a particular suite capability by configuring the Kubernetes controllers scaling controls, or adding or removing cluster nodes, or both.
  • Kubernetes controllers scaling: All Kubernetes controllers have ways to offer horizontal scaling.
  • Cluster node scaling: Because of scaling a Suite capability and thus the Kubernetes controllers it may become necessary to add, reconfigure, or remove a node. 

For more information, see Elasticity.

Scalable pods

Your suite system supports manual pod scaling. For a list of scalable pods, see the Scaling section in Suite enterprise readiness.

Suite deployment scaling

You can change your deployment sizing profile before a version update. This feature is helpful if you initially started with a Small deployment as you had a limited number of users, and now need to scale up to a larger deployment as you onboard more users.

For details, see the relevant section in Upgrade the suite (embedded Kubernetes) or Upgrade the suite (managed Kubernetes).

UD/UCMDB deployment scaling

You can change the deployment size of Containerized UD/UCMDB. For details, see Change the UD/UCMDB deployment size. 

OO deployment scaling

During the installation of Operations Orchestration (OO) Containerized, you can specify a deployment size with the global.oo.size parameter. After the installation, you can still reconfigure the OO Containerized deployment size. For details, see Adjust the sizing of OO deployment.

Smart analytics scaling

You can add content servers and increase the replicas of the DAH servers to improve the performance of Smart Analytics. 

Smart search content group scaling

If the Smart Search performance isn't good enough, you can add content for Smart Search to balance the search requests by using more content servers. For details, see Content group scaling. 

Scale out the DAH server

You can manually scale out the DAH server when either of the following occurs:

  • The search performance is slow in the suite system.
  • A response timeout issue occurs when you check the Smart Analytics configuration in Suite Administration to view the status.

For details, see Scale out DAH server.

DND scaling

If you have Design and Deploy (DND) deployed and enabled, you can increase the throughput by scaling up the itom-dnd-controller pod. For details, see Scale up the DND pods.
